intro: Ortholoma dictyophyllum, commonly known as the laceleaf ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its intricate, fern-like leaves that are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Ortholoma dictyophyllum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
